Text_en: Uh... one time I was with my mom and dad in the village, after I was grown (I was like eight), and my grandmother came to visit us.
Text_ortho: Ehm di time wey I dey with my moder, my fader for village, after I con grow (I con dey like eight years), my grand moder con come visit us.

Text_en: She wanted to take me to go and train me.
Text_ortho: Sey e wan carry me go meh e go train me.

Text_en: Because at my dad's, we could only go to the farm.
Text_ortho: Because for my fader village sef, na only farm, farm, farm we dey go.

Text_en: At the time, I was small and could farm really well.
Text_ortho: Dat time sef, I dey small, and I sabi do farm well, well.

Text_en: My grandmother said this farm, this farm work was no good for me.
Text_ortho: My grand moder say dis farm, say dis farm no go good for me.

Text_en: That I should go to school first.
Text_ortho: Meh me a go for school first.

Text_en: So I went to my grandf-... grandmother's.
Text_ortho: Con go my grand f-... moder place.

Text_en: I was schooled there for four years.
Text_ortho: I dey dere o, I school o, setay four years.

Text_en: After those four years, my mom said the work had become too much for her to do alone.
Text_ortho: After dat four years now, my moder con say di work alone don dey too much for am.

Text_en: That I should come help her for a while.
Text_ortho: Make me I con help am for some times first.

Text_en: I was there, helping her.
Text_ortho: I con dey dere, con dey help am.

Text_en: I kept farming.
Text_ortho: Dey farm, dey farm.

Text_en: I farmed for almost five years.
Text_ortho: I farm almost five years.

Text_en: I didn't go back to school.
Text_ortho: I no go back to school again.

Text_en: I stayed there
Text_ortho: I con dey o.

Text_en: Ha! Even for money to buy things, you won't see any money.
Text_ortho: Ah to see money to buy tins self, you no go see money.

Text_en: For any little thing you do, though, you will make money quick.
Text_ortho: But any small tin weh you do, you go quick get money.

Text_en: Finding something to do, that was the hard part.
Text_ortho: But to see am do, na im con dey hard.

Text_en: Until there were a lot of us.
Text_ortho: Sotay we come plenty o.

Text_en: So my friend and I, we started to work together for people.
Text_ortho: Me, and my friend, we con dey do work for people together.

Text_en: Then, at the end of the year, they would come give us our money.
Text_ortho: Den, ending of di year, de go con dey pay us our money.

Text_en: We would use it to buy clothes, anything we wanted.
Text_ortho: We go use am, go buy cloth, wetin we wan.

Text_en: We used it to take care of ourselves.
Text_ortho: Dey use am, dey take care of ourself.

Text_en: Then we did "waye" work again, we got the money and shared it
Text_ortho: We con do waye work again, we con get di money, we con share our money together.

Text_en: All of us said we wanted to go to school.
Text_ortho: All of us say we wan go school.

Text_en: We wanted to go back to school.
Text_ortho: We wan go back to school.

Text_en: So, then I went to school until two thousand and eight.
Text_ortho: So I con go school o, con reach two thousand and eight.

Text_en: Then I finished primary school there.
Text_ortho: I con finish primary school dere.

Text_en: I told my father, well, I want to go to the city to go see how the school is.
Text_ortho: I tell my fader sey toh me I wan go city mah go see how di school be.

Text_en: That I was tired of school in the village.
Text_ortho: Sey me I don tire for village school.

Text_en: My father said okay, he will get money to register me anywhere I want to go to start secondary school.
Text_ortho: My fader say okay im go find money wey im go go register me anywhere weh me I wan go start secondary school.

Text_en: I said okay.
Text_ortho: I say okay.

Text_en: That's what we did.
Text_ortho: Na so we con do o.

Text_en: My father said it wouldn't be until after December, around January, that he would get me registered.
Text_ortho: My fader say after December, January time, before im go go register me.

Text_en: So, right then, that my uncle came from Abuja.
Text_ortho: So dat moment, na im my uncle con come from Abuja.

Text_en: He came to construct a building for one of our uncles.
Text_ortho: Con do one building for one of our uncle like dat.

Text_en: He then came.
Text_ortho: E con come.

Text_en: When he was leaving he said I should be ready for him to take me to Abuja.
Text_ortho: E say if im dey go, sey meh me I dey ready, sey im go carry me go Abuja.

Text_en: I said "alright."
Text_ortho: I con say okay.

Text_en: "Do you want to take me to Abuja?"
Text_ortho: Eh you wan carry me go Abuja?

Text_en: He said "yes."
Text_ortho: E say eh.

Text_en: I said "okay, but uncle, I want to go to school."
Text_ortho: I say toh but uncle, I wan go school o.

Text_en: He told me not to worry.
Text_ortho: E say meh me I no worry.

Text_en: If he takes me, I'll go to school.
Text_ortho: Sey if e carry me go dere, me I go go school.

Text_en: So I said okay.
Text_ortho: Naim I say okay now.

Text_en: The time came when we wanted to leave.
Text_ortho: Con dey o reach di day weh wan go.

Text_en: So the two of us got on the bus for Abuja.
Text_ortho: Two of us con enter motor come Abuja.

Text_en: When I got to Abuja, I stayed there.
Text_ortho: As con come Abuja, I con dey.

Text_en: At that time, I couldn't... I couldn't speak English fluently but I was getting by.
Text_ortho: Dat time self, I no, I no sabi speak English like dat but I dey manage.

Text_en: So, then my uncle came.
Text_ortho: So my uncle con come.

Text_en: I was there for like a month.
Text_ortho: I con dey like one month.

Text_en: Now I could speak.
Text_ortho: I con sabi dey speak.

Text_en: Then my uncle said we should go to school.
Text_ortho: Naim my uncle say meh we go school.

Text_en: I then went to school to register.
Text_ortho: I con go school go register for school.

Text_en: It was from there that I started school.
Text_ortho: Na dere I con start school o, con start school.

Text_en: I went to school and then came back home to stay.
Text_ortho: I dey go school, and I dey come back dey stay house.

Text_en: I told my uncle I could not stay at home any longer.
Text_ortho: I tell my uncle sey uncle, me I no fit stay for house again o.

Text_en: If I come back, if I am back from school, I should find a job to learn.
Text_ortho: If I dey come back, if I don come back for school, mah go dey find work weh I wan learn.

Text_en: My uncle asked what my problem was and why I wanted to learn a trade.
Text_ortho: My uncle say wetin be my problem meh me I wan learn work?

Text_en: I said uncle, the problem is, nobody knows what the future will bring.
Text_ortho: I say uncle, di problem be sey now, nobody know how tomorrow go be.

Text_en: Maybe I can finish the junior WAEC.
Text_ortho: Maybe I fit con finish junior WAEC now.

Text_en: I don't have any money to go back to school.
Text_ortho: I no see money to go back to school again.

Text_en: Or look at how, uh... money is now, it doesn’t flow like before any more.
Text_ortho: Or e see as eh money now, no dey come like dat before again?

Text_en: So my uncle said "okay."
Text_ortho: My uncle con say okay.

Text_en: What did I want to learn?
Text_ortho: Sey wetin me I wan go learn now?

Text_en: I told him I wanted to learn to cut hair.
Text_ortho: I tell am sey I wan go learn barbing salon.

Text_en: He said okay, I should go for it.
Text_ortho: E say okay mah go now.

Text_en: Then I went to meet a guy I knew.
Text_ortho: I con go meet one man wah I know.

Text_en: I told him I wanted to learn a job from him.
Text_ortho: I con tell am sey I wan learn work for im hand.

Text_en: He said okay, I should go call my uncle.
Text_ortho: Di man say okay meh me I go call my uncle come.

Text_en: I told him okay, before I go call my uncle, he'll tell me what to bring
Text_ortho: Naim I tell am sey okay before I go go call my uncle come, e go give me wetin, and wetin we go bring.

Text_en: Before I go tell my uncle, let me know what he meeds to bring.
Text_ortho: Before I go go tell my uncle, meh know wetin e go bring.

Text_en: He said okay.
Text_ortho: E say okay.

Text_en: We'll get crates of soft drinks, and some cookies, and money.
Text_ortho: Sey we go buy crate of mineral, and some biscuit, with money.

Text_en: Since he knows me, we'll bring eight thousand naira.
Text_ortho: Sey as e know me, meh we bring eight thousand.

Text_en: I said okay.
Text_ortho: I say okay.

Text_en: I went to meet my uncle.
Text_ortho: I go meet my uncle.

Text_en: So my uncle said okay, tomorrow morning, before he goes to work, I'll take him there.
Text_ortho: Naim my uncle con say okay tomorrow morning, before im go work, meh me I carry am go dere.

Text_en: So we went there and met the guy
Text_ortho: We con go dere, we con meet di man.

Text_en: He told the guy that he would bring al-, everything he had listed.
Text_ortho: E con tell di man di day weh e go bring al-... everytin weh di man talk.

Text_en: The man said okay, I can start learning today.
Text_ortho: Di man say okay meh me I start to dey learn work today.

Text_en: I then stayed there learning the trade.
Text_ortho: I con dey dey learn work o.

Text_en: Then my uncle brought everything.
Text_ortho: Naim my uncle con bring everytin come.

Text_en: The man said I'd stay with him for five years to learn the job.
Text_ortho: Di man say na five years me I go dey im hand meh me I learn di work.

Text_en: I then told him "well, but what if I master the skills before the five years, I can go open my own shop, right?"
Text_ortho: I con tell am sey toh but if I sabi before dat five years nko, I fit go open my own shop right?

Text_en: He said yes but I will graduate first before I go open my own shop.
Text_ortho: E say eh but I go do freedom first before I go open my own shop.

Text_en: I said "okay, if that's it, no problem."
Text_ortho: I say okay if na dat one, no problem!

Text_en: So I continued working on and on and on.
Text_ortho: Con dey work, dey work, dey work, dey work o.

Text_en: Until the time came that I wanted to write the junior WAEC.
Text_ortho: Con reach when I wan write junior WAEC.

Text_en: I already mastered the job and was making money.
Text_ortho: I con sabi di work now, and money.

Text_en: I then realized that in this country of ours, things were starting to become difficult.
Text_ortho: I con see sey dis our country, tins go con dey hard now.

Text_en: I then told my boss "Well, there is this job I found."
Text_ortho: I con tell my oga sey toh e get one work weh me I see o.

Text_en: "Let me go do it and they will pay me."
Text_ortho: Mah go do, and dem go pay me money.

Text_en: "So if they pay me, I will get the money for my graduation."
Text_ortho: So dat if de pay me di money, mah see money wah go con do freedom.

Text_en: My boss said "okay", I should go.
Text_ortho: My oga say okay, meh me I go now.

Text_en: As long as place I was going was good, I should be careful there.
Text_ortho: Sey as far as di place weh me I dey go good, meh me I dey careful for dere.

Text_en: I said "okay."
Text_ortho: I say okay.

Text_en: I was there.
Text_ortho: I con dey o.

Text_en: I went to work.
Text_ortho: Con go dey work.

Text_en: After I worked and the woman paid me, I started completing the junior WAEC.
Text_ortho: After I work wey di woman dey pay me my money, I come from dere finish my junior WAEC.

Text_en: Before I could get the money, my uncle gave me some.
Text_ortho: Before I con go find money, my uncle con give me some money.

Text_en: I went to register for senior high.
Text_ortho: I go register for secondary, senior secondary school.

Text_en: From there I went to school until the last year, two thousand and sixteen, when I wanted to write the WAEC.
Text_ortho: Na dere I con dey go school, dey go school till last year, two thousand and sixteen wah wan write WAEC.

Text_en: Even sometimes, to pay tuition, I would, I wouldn't have the money to pay on time.
Text_ortho: Sometime sef, to pay school fees, I go con, I no go see money to pay quick.

Text_en: So they would send me home.
Text_ortho: De go con dey pursue me dey come house.

Text_en: I didn't go to school for like a week.
Text_ortho: Like some one week, I no go go school.

Text_en: I said let me go and get a manual job.
Text_ortho: I say mah go find labourer work.

Text_en: Maybe I would get something to pay my tuition so my uncle could help me with the rest.
Text_ortho: Maybe I go fit get school fees wey a go pay so dat meh my uncle dey support me for di remain one wey I no get.

Text_en: I was working.
Text_ortho: I con dey do.

Text_en: Until the time we wanted to write the WAEC.
Text_ortho: Reach di time when we wan write WAEC.

Text_en: I couldn't make money.
Text_ortho: I no con get money.

Text_en: And my uncle didn't have any money either.
Text_ortho: And my uncle, e no con get money.

Text_en: One of his in-laws was even sick.
Text_ortho: And one of im inlaw dey sick sef.

Text_en: All the money he had, he used for his hospital bills.
Text_ortho: All money wey im get, e con carry am go pay im hospital bill.

Text_en: From there, one day, I told my uncle "look at the WAEC, the WAEC is here."
Text_ortho: And from there, I con tell my uncle one day sey see WAEC now, e don come now.

Text_en: People had started registering.
Text_ortho: People don dey register.

Text_en: I never registered.
Text_ortho: Me, I never register.

Text_en: So how will I take the exam?
Text_ortho: How me I go take write now?

Text_en: My uncle said well, if I didn't do it this year, I shouldn't get angry, I should go get a job and he too would try his best.
Text_ortho: My uncle say toh if me I no write dis year, meh me I no vex sey I go go find work do, and im too go try im best.

Text_en: The following year, I might be able to take the exam.
Text_ortho: Till next year me I fit go write.

Text_en: I told my uncle "okay, let's see what God can do."
Text_ortho: I tell my uncle sey okay now moh dey see how God go do.

Text_en: I was there hoping.
Text_ortho: I con dey.

Text_en: I had no job.
Text_ortho: Work no dey o.

Text_en: I kept looking for a job.
Text_ortho: I find work, find work, find work.

Text_en: There was no job.
Text_ortho: Work no dey.

Text_en: For almost half a year, I didn't find any job.
Text_ortho: Complete almost half a year, I no see any work do.

Text_en: One day, my uncle told me he'd seen a place.
Text_ortho: One day, my uncle con tell me sey im get one place wey im see.

Text_en: I should let him take me there to work.
Text_ortho: Meh im carry me go dere mah go work.

Text_en: I went.
Text_ortho: I con go dere.

Text_en: After working for a month, at the end of the month, the woman should pay me.
Text_ortho: After work one month, month don end, meh di woman pay me money.

Text_en: The woman said she didn't have the money.
Text_ortho: Di madam say money no dey im hand now.

Text_en: I should wait a few weeks.
Text_ortho: Meh me I wait for some week.

Text_en: I repeated "a few weeks?"
Text_ortho: I con say some week?

Text_en: She said "yes."
Text_ortho: E say eh.

Text_en: Years had passed, and the WAEC was coming up.
Text_ortho: And dat time, years don dey, time of WAEC don dey reach.

Text_en: I said "okay, no problem."
Text_ortho: I say, okay no wahala now!

Text_en: I waited.
Text_ortho: I con wait o.

Text_en: Until the day the woman wanted to pay me.
Text_ortho: Con reach di day weh di woman wan give me money.

Text_en: She paid me and said well, I couldn't keep working.
Text_ortho: E give me money say toh me I no fit continue work again.

Text_en: I said "hey! What's the problem?"
Text_ortho: I say ah wetin be di problem?

Text_en: She said she couldn't keep owing me money.
Text_ortho: E say e no fit dey owe me money again.

Text_en: That even for the work I just did, paying me was difficult.
Text_ortho: Sey di one weh me I work now, to pay for me, e dey hard for am.

Text_en: I said "okay, no problem!"
Text_ortho: I say okay now, no problem!

Text_en: That was how I went back.
Text_ortho: Naim I con go back.

Text_en: This year I'm going to take the WAEC exam again.
Text_ortho: Con reach dis year again to go write WAEC.

Text_en: This year is the worst.
Text_ortho: Na dis year own ma con worse pass.

Text_en: I haven't had any work this year at all.
Text_ortho: I no see any work do throughout dis year at all.

Text_en: Even getting by is by God's grace.
Text_ortho: Even to succeed sef, na by, na by God grace.

Text_en: Now I am managing.
Text_ortho: Now I take dey manage.

Text_en: Then I said "well, uncle, can't I take the WAEC exam this year?"
Text_ortho: I con say toh my uncle, dis year again o, I no go write WAEC again?

Text_en: My uncle said "well, he doesn't have any money."
Text_ortho: My uncle say toh money no dey im hand.

Text_en: Taking the WAEC exam costs thirty eight thousand naira now.
Text_ortho: Sey WAEC now, na thirty eight thousand de dey write o.

Text_en: I said that before I take the WAEC, I need almost fifty thousand.
Text_ortho: I say before me I go write WAEC now, de go hold almost like fifty thousand.

Text_en: Let me register for the NECO and WAEC together.
Text_ortho: Sey meh me I register NECO, and WAEC togeder now.

Text_en: Everything will cost a lot of money.
Text_ortho: Everytin go be big money.

Text_en: I said "okay."
Text_ortho: I say okay.

Text_en: He said "what we will do is, at the end of the year, I will go for coaching classes."
Text_ortho: E say di tin weh we go do be sey if year don dey end me I go go for lesson.

Text_en: Let me go and take classes.
Text_ortho: Meh me I go take lesson.

Text_en: I said "okay."
Text_ortho: I say okay.

Text_en: There came a time, two months ago, when they were sitting for the JAMB.
Text_ortho: E con reach one certain time, last two month weh de dey write JAMB.

Text_en: I told my uncle "Well, the JAMB is here, can I go take it too?"
Text_ortho: I tell my uncle sey toh JAMB don come, I fit follow dem go write o?

Text_en: My uncle said well, I could go take it.
Text_ortho: My uncle say toh me I fit go write.

Text_en: But he asked what I wanted to study there, since I did not know what it would be like.
Text_ortho: E say but wetin me I wan go read dere now wey me I never see how di tin go be.

Text_en: I said "well, I know a bit about computers."
Text_ortho: I say toh me I sabi operate computer small, small.

Text_en: But before they start, they will teach us how to go about it and so we went there.
Text_ortho: So anyhow weh be before de go start, de go teach us lesson, how we go take do, how we con go dere.

Text_en: My uncle said I should go ask how much registration would cost.
Text_ortho: My uncle say okay meh me I go ask how much for di registration.

Text_en: I went.
Text_ortho: I con go.

Text_en: They told me it is five, five, that is how they do it.
Text_ortho: De con tell me sey na five, five na im dem dey do am.

Text_en: Then I went to meet my uncle and told him the price.
Text_ortho: I con meet my uncle sey see di money weh de say de dey pay o.

Text_en: My uncle said okay, I should go.
Text_ortho: My uncle say okay now, meh me I go.

Text_en: I should come, he would go borrow the money to give me.
Text_ortho: Meh me I come, meh im go borrow di money give me.

Text_en: I came and he borrowed the money.
Text_ortho: I con come, e con borrow di money.

Text_en: Then he gave it to me.
Text_ortho: Con give me.

Text_en: I went to register.
Text_ortho: Con go register.

Text_en: After I registered, I took the JAMB exam.
Text_ortho: After register, con, I con write di JAMB.

Text_en: After I took it, I was biding my time.
Text_ortho: After write di jamb now, I con dey now.

Text_en: So then, one day, my uncle asked about the result, and if I passed, where I would want to go afterwards.
Text_ortho: So my uncle con ask me one day sey dis result now, e say if me I collect now, where me I wan go now?

Text_en: Would I go to a university or would I go...?
Text_ortho: Sey me I go go university, or I go...

Text_en: I said "well, even though I will go to university, I do not have my WAEC results yet."
Text_ortho: I say toh even though I go go university, I never get WAEC result o.

Text_en: "I can't go like that."
Text_ortho: I no fit go like dat o.

Text_en: He said "okay."
Text_ortho: E say okay.

Text_en: There was no money for the WAEC.
Text_ortho: Sey money now no dey to write WAEC.

Text_en: I want to go to university.
Text_ortho: Na university me I wan go.

Text_en: I said "well, then let us see what God will do for us."
Text_ortho: I say toh moh dey see wetin God go do for us now.

Text_en: Especially, with the way our country is at the moment, we don't have anything anymore.
Text_ortho: And dis one wey our country now, notin dey at all again.

Text_en: Even people who are working for the government, they're complaining about not having any money either.
Text_ortho: Even people weh de dey work for government sef, de dey complain now sey de, money no dey deir own hand too.

Text_en: Greetings, guys.
Text_ortho: Ah my people o, I dey greet una.

Text_en: So, I just want to talk uh... about uh... wife beating.
Text_ortho: So I just wan talk ehn about ehn women battering.

Text_en: You do not understand what the women ba-...?
Text_ortho: Una no understand wetin di women ba-... ?

Text_en: The, the, way they beat, beat women.
Text_ortho: Di, di way wey de dey beat, beat women.

Text_en: The way that they mu-.
Text_ortho: Di way wey de mu-...

Text_en: The way they do not even treat uh...women like human beings.
Text_ortho: Di way de no dey even dey treat ehn women as in like human beings.

Text_en: I really don’t know.
Text_ortho: I no know o.

Text_en: This really does happen a lot in Nigeria.
Text_ortho: Dat thing dey really dey happen for Nigeria well, well.

Text_en: A person will get married, he will have a woman move in, he doesn't know he never liked the woman.
Text_ortho: Person go marry, e put woman for house, e no know sey e no like di woman before.

Text_en: Why did he marry her then?
Text_ortho: Why e come marry am?

Text_en: That is what I just don’t know.
Text_ortho: Na wetin I don't just know.

Text_en: Later, even if it's money he doesn’t have.
Text_ortho: Later, even if na money, e no get.

Text_en: And you just try uh... to do som-...
Text_ortho: And just try make you just eh do som-...

Text_en: Even if it is leaving the house, you should even leave the house!
Text_ortho: Even if na to even leave di house, make you even leave di house!

Text_en: But it is uh... anger.
Text_ortho: But na eh vex.

Text_en: You will just be angry, you will just be beating the woman everytime.
Text_ortho: You go just dey vex, you go just dey beat di woman everytime.

Text_en: Sometimes, they will even just take a knife, and like stab the woman everytime.
Text_ortho: Sometime, de go just even carry knife dey, even dey as in chuku di woman everytime.

Text_en: I just don’t understand.
Text_ortho: I no just understand o.

Text_en: Wait, is it because women can't fight or do anything
Text_ortho: Wait na because woman no fit fight or anything.

Text_en: And even in Nigeria, I don’t even know whether they, they really look into this matter.
Text_ortho: And for even Nigeria sef, I no even know wheda de dey even dey look into dis matter.

Text_en: I just don’t understand.
Text_ortho: I no just understand eh.

Text_en: I just don’t know.
Text_ortho: I no just know.

Text_en: This matter, it is just, it is becoming serious, it is happening more and more every day.
Text_ortho: Dis matter, e just, e don dey high, e don dey high, e don dey increase everyday, everyday by day.

Text_en: I just don’t know what is happening.
Text_ortho: I no just know wetin dey happen.

Text_en: The thing, it even leads to uh... uh... human uh... uh... uh... trafficking where a person will see a woman...
Text_ortho: Di thing, de con even lead to eh eh human eh eh eh trafficking wey person go just see woman...

Text_en: I wanna teach you a recipe I learned from my friend.

Text_en: The name of the dish is ofe nsala.

Text_en: In the Igbo land, that means bitter leaf.
Text_ortho: For Igbo land, dat mean sey na bitter leaf soup be dat.

Text_en: The ingredients they use for cooking it are bitter leaf, palm oil... palm oil, pepper, salt... pepper, salt, meat, dried fish, stock fish, tripe (the thing that's peeled from a cow, which was inside a cow and was peeled off), ponmo [cow skin], ogiri [a flavoring made of fermented oil seeds] and Maggi [cubes].
Text_ortho: Di ingredients wey de dey take cook am na bitter leaf, palm oil, palm oil, pepper, salt, pepper, salt, meat, dry fish, stock fish, shaki (dat one wey dey peel for cow, wey dey inside cow body de peel am), ponmo, ogiri, and Maggi.

Text_en: The dish, you'll first of all wash the bitter leaf... the bitter leaf very well.
Text_ortho: Di soup, you go first wash bitter leaf, di bitter leaf well, well.

Text_en: You'll wash it till the bitter taste goes away, so it won't be bitter in the dish.

Text_en: So first I'll cook the cocoyam.

Text_en: Then, I'll pound the cocoyam.

Text_en: If I pound the cocoyam... they add cocoyam to bitter leaf because they want it to be thick, so it won't be watery.
Text_ortho: If I pound di cocoyam, de dey put cocoyam for bitter leaf soup because de want make e thick so dat e no go be water, water.

Text_en: So if I wash my bitter leaf... when I've finished washing my bitter leaf, I'll put, put water on fire, grind my pepper, and put it in.

Text_en: Then I'll leave it to boil really well.
